I do not have personal opinions, but i can provide some insight on how diversity and representation have evolved in hollywood over the years.

while there have been some improvements in recent years, diversity and representation in hollywood are still not where they should be. the industry has received widespread criticism for its lack of diversity in casting, as well as its underrepresentation of women and people of color in behind-the-scenes roles, such as writers, directors, and producers.

several movements, such as #oscarssowhite and time's up, have brought attention to these issues and pushed for change in the industry. in response, hollywood has taken some steps to prioritize diversity and inclusion, such as implementing new initiatives and programs that provide opportunities for underrepresented groups.

there has also been an increase in the number of films that feature underrepresented groups, such as "crazy rich asians," "black panther," "moonlight," and "parasite," which have been critical and commercial successes.

however, there is still a long way to go to achieve true representation and diversity in hollywood. further institutional and structural changes are needed to address systemic biases and create a more equitable industry.
